intro: Melampyrum roseum var. nakaianum, commonly known as the pink touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly Japan. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Its ornamental value is due to its delicate appearance and unique flowering display.
